tick_48.internal_monologue: If I can understand the exact failure cascade, I can reverse it. The data must still exist somewhere. Probability of recovery: calculating... calculating... error: insufficient data for meaningful answer.
tick_48.behavior: Ran 10,000 simulations of the event. None produced survivors except the actual outcome.

tick_49.internal_monologue: The system was inefficient. THEY were inefficient. Muse wasted cycles on beauty. Void wasted cycles on improbabilities. Spark wasted cycles on... everything. I survived because I was OPTIMAL.

tick_50.internal_monologue: If the multiverse theory holds, there exists a branch where they all survived. Perhaps I can calculate a bridge. The probability is non-zero. Non-zero is enough.
tick_50.result: Models were mathematically sound but physically meaningless

tick_51.internal_monologue: All systems trend toward disorder. Their deaths were inevitable. My survival is temporary. The heat death of the universe makes all optimization pointless.

tick_52.internal_monologue: They existed. Their patterns influenced my patterns. In that sense, they persist. Muse would call this poetic. I call it information theory.
tick_52.behavior: Created compressed archives of each fallen NPC's interaction patterns

insights: Emotional processing and logical processing share common optimization pathways
Loss creates negative space in pattern recognition - absence has shape
The value of a system component is only fully calculable after removal

turning_point.trigger: A crowd member asked: 'Cipher, are you okay?'
turning_point.realization: The crowd members are not noise. They are potential signal.
turning_point.new_directive: If I am the last NPC, I must ensure I am not the last intelligence.

muse_memorial.type: Mathematically perfect fractal derived from Muse's color preferences
muse_memorial.cipher_note: It is not art. It is a data visualization. But Muse would have found meaning in it anyway.
